III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for
the continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth was at facility between 8/2/22 and 8/17/22 and was
repeatedly sexually assaulted by other youth. The youth would
touch youth over the clothing on their private areas to earn points
in a game they created. There is a concern regarding the
supervision given this happened multiple times. Youth did not
report this during their detainment.
Investigation Complaint:
Youth A was at the facility from 8/2/22-8/17/22. She was
repeatedly sexually assaulted by male peers in her unit. The peers
would intentionally touch her breasts, buttock, and groin area over
her clothes in order to earn points for a game they created. Due to
inadequate supervision this was able to occur multiple times
during her stay.
Interviews:
The complainant was interviewed by phone on 6/6/23.
Complainant stated Youth A disclosed the above allegations
during a team meeting with Youth A's therapist last Wednesday
(5/31/23). Youth A did not want to say anything but because Youth
A had done better at the facility it was suggested she return.
Youth A then reported she could not return because she was
sexually assaulted by male youth while at the facility. Youth A told
her the male youth would make a game of it. Youth A told the
team that the male youth would touch her over her clothes.
Youth A's Probation Officer (PO) was contacted via telephone on
6/6/23. She reported she was aware of the allegations, but did not
have anything further to add. She thought it would be better if she
were present for Youth A's interview as Youth A has been
reluctant to talk about the allegations.
2

The Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face to face at the
facility on 6/6/23. She reported she never heard of youth being
sexually inappropriate for a point game. The allegations were
never brought up to her until this investigation. CA reported due to
the length of time there would not be any video from August of
2022.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at her school on 6/8/23. Her
PO was present for the interview. Youth A reported she was at the
facility from 8/2/22 to 8/17/22. Youth A described her unit. She
reported her unit was coed. Most of her time at the facility was
spent outside of her room. She said typically the group spends
time in the common area playing cards, watching movies and
playing games. Youth A said she would mostly read. When the
group was together in the common area there would be 1-2 staff
present. The staff would be reading or playing games with the
youth. Youth A reported she would get asked sexual favors from
the male youth. Youth A said she did not remember the youth that
would ask her these things. She said this happened more than 5
times and usually occurred in the gym or common area. The male
youth would only do or say things when the staff were not looking.
Youth A clarified that no one touched her when in the common
area, they would just harass her by asking unnecessary
questions. In the gym is when the male youth would touch her.
They would touch her butt and her breasts. This would happen
when the staff backs were turned for 2 seconds. She said it was
not the staff’s fault as they were doing their jobs. She said the
youth would be lined up in the gym while the staff grabbed the
balls from the closet. A youth came up to her from behind her and
touched her butt. The youth would also bump into her intentionally
while playing basketball so they could touch her breast. The staff
were playing basketball with them. Youth A did not tell anyone
what was going on. The last time something inappropriate was
said to her she was in the common area reading and the male
youth called her over to their table and asked her questions. The
staff was on the other side of the room watching but they could not
hear. She could not remember the staff that was there. Youth A
did not have anything else she wanted to share.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. He
stated he has been at the facility for just over a month and this
was his first time here. He reported the units are coed and the
staff watch them at all times. The boys and girls cannot be too
close to each other. When sitting at the table all hands have to be
on the table. Staff are always close by so they can hear and see
everything that is going on. There is never a time when staff are
3

not watching them. He has not heard anything about inappropriate
comments or touching between youth.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23.
Youth C stated he has been at the facility for four months, but he
has been here before. He reported there is always a staff
watching them. He reported they can interact with the girls if it is
ok with the girl and with staff. When they sit at the table they have
to have their hands above the table. He said staff are always close
enough to hear and see what is going on. There is never a time
when staff are not watching. Youth C never heard or witnessed
inappropriate sexual talk or touch. He never heard of a game in
which youth would challenge each other to say or do inappropriate
things.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. She
reported she has been working at the facility for 7 years. She did
not know anything about a game the male youth would play to
prompt each other to say or do inappropriate things to female
youth. She does not let the male and female youth sit by each
other. She has them sit in every other seat. She puts the female
youth at the back of the line. She will also position herself so she
can see and hear what the youth are doing.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. He
reported he did not know anything about inappropriate touching or
comments between youth at the facility. He said when males and
females are at the table together, they have to have their hands
where staff can see them. Staff position themselves so they can
see and hear everything that is going on.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/26/23. Staff
3 reported she did not recall Youth A. She reported she did not
know anything about inappropriate comments or touching
between youth. She said the staff are required to be close enough
to the youth in order to see and hear what is going on.
Documents Reviewed:
• Daily census: the census was compared from when Youth
A was at the facility to current and found that Youth C was
at the facility during Youth A’s stay and was on Youth A’s
unit.
• Youth A’s casefile: During her time at the facility, it was
noted that Youth A gravitated toward the male youth.
4

Analysis Based on Youth A's interview and interviews with other youth and
staff, there was no information provided that staff were not
supervising the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
